channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Complete - Rescue; INC#1211; 05:30PM; 7319 N Hazeltine Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ppEvu6; #VanNuys; Though the construction site prohibited direct access and rescue operations solely via an LAFD aerial ladder truck, firefighters were able to extend the truck's 100' aerial ladder to use a a distant high point, allowing LAFD responders to use ground ladders and a two-line rope/harness system to successfully lower the worker to safety. The 39-year-old man, who reportedly experienced a severe lower abdominal injury - possibly from a nail gun discharge, is now being medically evaluated and prepared for hospital transport by LAFD Paramedics.; FS 81; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC10 E239 E288 E39 E88 RA60 RA88 T39 T88 UR88; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Rescue; INC#1211; 04:41PM; 7319 N Hazeltine Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ppEvu6; #VanNuys; PRELIM: Adult male construction worker (conflicting report of injury), conscious and alert, stranded on unstable scaffolding at third floor level at rear of an apartment building. As confined location prohibits access by LAFD aerial ladder truck, firefighters - including those specially trained and equipped for urban search & rescue, are preparing to use ground ladders and possibly a rope/harness system to safety remove the man. ; FS 81; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC10 E239 E288 E39 E88 RA60 RA88 T39 T88 UR88; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0854; 12:57PM; 745 S Stanford Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/4a0GAmv; #DowntownLA; *Corrected Address* Thirty-four firefighters responded to a two-story center-hallway apartment building with fire in one unit on the first floor. Crews deployed hose lines to make an aggressive interior fire attack, quickly containing the flames to just the unit of origin and eliminating the fire in 14 minutes from the time of alarm. A search of the unit, thankfully, did not reveal any occupants to be inside. Firefighters will remain on scene to set up blowers and systematically ventilate all smoke out of the building. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation. ; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E17 E209 E210 E9 RA17 RA804 SQ21 T10 T9; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0854; 12:43PM; 820 E Agatha St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3TkIIOQ; #DowntownLA; Two-story apartment building with smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E17 E209 E210 E9 RA17 RA804 SQ21 T10 T9; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1394; 06:25PM; 20345 W Londelius St; MAP: https://bit.ly/43vhiuq; #Winnetka; Firefighters responded to a one-story home with heavy fire showing from the attached garage. Crews quickly advanced hose lines inside to attack the garage fire and stop the advancing flames before they entered the living area of the home. Firefighters discovered the garage fire spread into the attic, and put fire attack on pause to perform salvage operations inside (gathering valuables and belongings and covering them to avoid further damage due to smoke or water), before opening up the ceiling and roof to access the burning attic. Ultimately, it took 32 firefighters 25 minutes to access, confine, and extinguish the attic fire. One adult female was evaluated for minor smoke inhalation and found to be in good condition. She declined hospital transport. The occupants will be displaced and Red Cross is responding to help them during this transition period. No firefighter injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 104; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC15 BC17 E103 E104 E107 E273 E296 RA104 RA896 SO1 T73 T96; CH8; 18; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1394; 06:00PM; 20345 W Londelius St; MAP: https://bit.ly/43vhiuq; #Winnetka; PRELIM:One-story single-family home, with heavy fire showing. Offensive mode.; FS 104; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC15 BC17 E103 E104 E107 E273 E296 RA104 RA896 T73 T96; CH9; 18; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1702; 09:47PM; 15314 Dickens St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3PsUtkZ; #ShermanOaks; Firefighters responded to an automotive shop (collision repair & paint shop) to find heavy smoke coming from inside the building. Crews made access to the inside of the building and found multiple vehicles burning inside. It took the first 28 firefighters just 18 minutes to access, confine, and extinguish the flames. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 88; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; BC10 BC14 CM40 CM42 E109 E239 E288 E293 E39 E83 E88 EM14 RA83 RA88 SO1 T39 T88 T93; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1702; 09:29PM; 15314 Dickens St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3PsUtkZ; #ShermanOaks; One-story commercial building with smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 88; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; BC10 BC14 CM40 CM42 E109 E239 E288 E293 E39 E83 E88 EM14 RA83 RA88 T39 T88 T93; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0226; 05:28AM; 3787 N Cahuenga Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/4aiZ3KD; #StudioCity; Firefighters responded to a 25’ x 100’ one-story commercial building with smoke showing to the rear. Firefighters found a detached A/V room with fire inside behind the main building, with flames threatening the commercial. Crews quickly deployed hose lines to the rear and extinguished the flames, keeping them from extending inside the main portion of the business. Ultimately, it took 34 firefighters 17 minutes to extinguish the flames. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 76; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; AR1 BC14 BC5 E239 E260 E278 E60 E76 E86 E97 RA76 RA86 RA860 SO1 T39 T60 T78; CH7; 17; Nicholas Prange

Hoist Rescue; INC#1587; 06:27PM; 7600 W Verdugo Crestline Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/49WiHw9; #Tujunga; Firefighters located a 29-year-old female in a remote area with a lower leg injury. Ground crews were unable to bring apparatus to the patient's location, therefore LAFD Air Operations utilized a hoist operation. A rescuer was lowered down to the patient to assess, treat, and prepare the patient for a hoist. LAFD Air Operations transported the patient by air to a local hospital. Nothing further.; FS 74; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC12 E24 E274 H5 H7 HA5 HA7 PB74 RA7 RA74 RH114 SO1 T74; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange
